headline: Microsoft Ties Xbox Leadership To AI Cloud And Security Ambitions
summary: Microsoft (NasdaqGS:MSFT) announced a leadership transition in its Gaming division, with Xbox chief Phil Spencer retiring and Asha Sharma taking over. headline: Trump Seeks Vows from Tech Executives to Cover Data Center Costs
summary: The effort includes pressing technology executives to sign non-binding compacts vowing that their companies would take on the cost of building the necessary infrastructure to support their data center use, said the people, who requested anonymity to discuss a plan that isn’t yet public.  Officials in President Donald Trump’s administration have been talking with Microsoft Corp., Alphabet Inc. and other companies about signing the pledges, the people said.  White House spokespeople didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment lodged after normal business hours Monday evening.

content.title: Trump Seeks Vows from Tech Executives to Cover Data Center Costs
content.summary: The effort includes pressing technology executives to sign non-binding compacts vowing that their companies would take on the cost of building the necessary infrastructure to support their data center use, said the people, who requested anonymity to discuss a plan that isn’t yet public.  Officials in President Donald Trump’s administration have been talking with Microsoft Corp., Alphabet Inc. and other companies about signing the pledges, the people said.  White House spokespeople didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment lodged after normal business hours Monday evening.

headline: Goldman Team Says Asset-Heavy Stocks Outperform on AI Fears
summary: The Goldman team said their basket of capital intensive stocks whose economic value derives from physical assets has outperformed a capital light group reliant on human or digital capital by about 35% since the start of 2025.  Investors are increasingly turning to stocks with what the strategists called the “HALO effect,” for heavy assets and low obsolescence, in sectors like utilities, basic resources and energy, the team including Guillaume Jaisson said in a client note.

content.title: Goldman Team Says Asset-Heavy Stocks Outperform on AI Fears
content.summary: The Goldman team said their basket of capital intensive stocks whose economic value derives from physical assets has outperformed a capital light group reliant on human or digital capital by about 35% since the start of 2025.  Investors are increasingly turning to stocks with what the strategists called the “HALO effect,” for heavy assets and low obsolescence, in sectors like utilities, basic resources and energy, the team including Guillaume Jaisson said in a client note.

headline: PRATUS® Selected as Official Incident Management Platform for the U.S. Coast Guard
summary: The U.S. Coast Guard Office of Emergency Management and Disaster Response (CG-OEM) has officially selected PRATUS® as its enterprise incident management platform, marking a significant milestone in the Service's Force Design 2028 modernization strategy. Built on Microsoft Azure Government and integrated with Microsoft 365, PRATUS will transform how the Coast Guard coordinates complex emergency operations.

Built on Microsoft Azure Government and integrated with Microsoft 365, PRATUS will transform how the Coast Guard coordinates complex emergency operations.

headline: Nucleus Research Releases 2026 SFA Technology Value Matrix
summary: In 2026, Sales Force Automation technology is defined by execution, not record keeping. As sales teams are asked to deliver predictable growth with constrained resources, SFA platforms are being evaluated on how directly they improve productivity, forecast accuracy, and deal progression. Core capabilities such as pipeline management and reporting remain foundational, but ROI is increasingly driven by how effectively platforms translate insight into action.

content.title: Nucleus Research Releases 2026 SFA Technology Value Matrix
content.summary: In 2026, Sales Force Automation technology is defined by execution, not record keeping. As sales teams are asked to deliver predictable growth with constrained resources, SFA platforms are being evaluated on how directly they improve productivity, forecast accuracy, and deal progression. Core capabilities such as pipeline management and reporting remain foundational, but ROI is increasingly driven by how effectively platforms translate insight into action.

headline: Microsoft’s $83.09 Billion Decision Could Shape What Happens Next
summary: Last quarter, Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) delivered a strong earnings beat, but one number overshadowed everything else: $29.88 billion in capital expenditures (CapEx) for Q2 FY2026, the quarter ended Dec. 31, 2025. That figure, reported in Microsoft’s 8-K filed Jan. 28, 2026, represents a 89% increase year-over-year from $15.80 billion — a near-doubling in a single quarter ... headline: 'Boring' energy, consumer staples stocks can buffer tech losses
summary:
STORY: Meanwhile, tech stocks have been "a mixed bag," Mussio said, with most falling - including Microsoft, Nvidia, Meta Platforms and Amazon.

He added that "it is worth noting" that companies such as Nvidia and Microsoft have market caps bigger than some entire sectors, "like energy, for example."

"And so I think it's just a really good reminder for investors to be diversified, not just across asset classes... but within the asset classes," he said, and to have some exposure to the "boring sectors" that offer diversification from Big Tech.

content.title: 'Boring' energy, consumer staples stocks can buffer tech losses
content.summary:
STORY: Meanwhile, tech stocks have been "a mixed bag," Mussio said, with most falling - including Microsoft, Nvidia, Meta Platforms and Amazon.

He added that "it is worth noting" that companies such as Nvidia and Microsoft have market caps bigger than some entire sectors, "like energy, for example."

"And so I think it's just a really good reminder for investors to be diversified, not just across asset classes... but within the asset classes," he said, and to have some exposure to the "boring sectors" that offer diversification from Big Tech.

headline: Michael Burry Warns MSFT, GOOG, META Are Using 'Sinister' Accounting To Hide AI Costs, Inflate Profits By 20%
summary: Famed “Big Short” investor Michael Burry has issued a scathing warning to Silicon Valley, alleging that tech giants are employing aggressive accounting maneuvers to mask the true costs of the AI infrastructure race. The ‘Sinister’ Accounting Trick Burry, in an X post, targeted a group of Big Tech companies, including Microsoft Corp. (NASDAQ:MSFT), Alphabet Inc. headline: What if the SaaSpocalypse is a myth?
summary: A trillion dollars of market value has vanished on the assumption that AI agents will make enterprise software obsolete. That assumption misunderstands the problem.
